intro: Neomolina racemosa, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces clusters of these flowers, which bloom during the dry season, making it a notable species in its native habitat. Neomolina racemosa is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
